fields.name: totara_comment_draft_item
fields.description:
Getting the draft reply/comment, which the content can either be a json_encoded document or just
purely text - depends on the text format. This is for preparing the content that being used by
the editor. Furthermore, the content will be run passed by the file system to make sure that all
the files are moved to draft.

fields.name: totara_comment_editor_weka
fields.description:
Since we are allowing the comment's editor to be flexible where it is being used, and the editor is only allow to
be locked down to the component it is used. Which in this case, the editor is locked down to the totara_comment
component. And totara_comment component is being used in different component - therefore we are going to fetch
the extensions for editor weka that the parent component want the editor to be. Then we will mask it with
the totara_comment component.

This query had been deprecated and the behaviour of the query had been changed.
Please use query editor_weka_editor instead.

args.name: component
args.description: The component of place where the comment's weka editor is being used.

args.name: area
args.description: The area of place where the comment's weka editor is being used.

args.name: comment_area
args.description: This is to identify whether it is for comment or reply.

args.name: id
args.description:
This parameter is deprecated. Do not use this input field, use query totara_comment_editor_weka_from_id instead
@deprecated

args.name: instance_id
args.description: The instance's id of which that is using the comment component.

args.name: draft_id
args.description: Draft item id needed for draft files

fields.name: totara_comment_editor_weka_from_id
fields.description:
This query will behave similar to query totara_comment_editor_weka. However, this query is fetching based
on either comment's id or reply's id as they are from the same table.

This query had been deprecated and the behaviour had been changed.
Please use query editor_weka_editor instead.

args.name: id
args.description: Either comment's id or reply's id.

args.name: comment_area
args.description: This is to identify whether it is for comment or reply.

args.name: draft_id
args.description: Draft item id needed for draft files

fields.name: totara_notification_event_resolvers
fields.description:
A query to fetch all the notifiable event resolvers within the system, and it is up to the
implementation of persist query to include the associated notification preferences
with the query or not.

args.name: extended_context
args.description:
Extended context MUST be provided, in order to create the notification preference
within that context. Note that the context's id for this extended_context can be fallback
to the context system if none is provided.

fields.description:
A query to fetch all the notification preferences under specific context which
can be listening to the notifiable event (if provided).

args.name: extended_context
args.description:
Extended context MUST be provided, in order to create the notification preference
within that context. Note that the context's id for this extended_context can be fallback
to the context system if none is provided.

args.name: resolver_class_name
args.description:
If this parameter is provided, we are fetching only the notification preferences that are listening to
this event only.

args.name: at_context_only
args.description:
Whether we want the list of notification preferences at the specific context only,
or the list that is a mix of overridden and non-overridden (higher context).

types.name: core_id
types.description: Represents database id fields (numeric string). 0 is converted to NULL.

types.name: param_integer
types.description: Input parameter equivalent to PARAM_INT, '' is converted to NULL.

types.name: param_text
types.description: Input parameter equivalent to PARAM_TEXT.

types.description: Input parameter equivalent to PARAM_BOOL, '' is converted to NULL.

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: core_pageable_result
types.description:
Represents a result that is broken up into 'pages' returning a subset of the data, an overall total record count plus
the next cursor containing the information needed to load the next page.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of records returned by the request (not the number returned in this result/page, but the overall count).

fields.name: next_cursor
fields.description:
Opaque string containing information to allow the system to identify the next set of results that should be returned
after this one. This value can be passed into a query that uses core_pagination_input to fetch the next page.

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric
values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: core_format
types.description: Rich-text output format. Note that some rich-text formats may not be renderable in other formats.

enumValues.name: RAW
enumValues.description: Outputs the stored value unchanged. Most commonly used when editing a value.

enumValues.name: HTML
enumValues.description: Outputs the stored value for display within an HTML page. Handles escaping of HTML entities.

enumValues.name: PLAIN
enumValues.description: Outputs the stored value in a way suitable for plain-text display.

enumValues.name: MARKDOWN
enumValues.description: Outputs the stored value in Markdown format.

enumValues.name: JSON_EDITOR
enumValues.description: Outputs the stored value in a JSON structure, suitable for use by a compatible JSON editor (e.g. Weka).

enumValues.name: MOBILE
enumValues.description: Outputs the stored value in a format suitable for use within the Totara mobile app.

types.name: core_date_format

List of supported output formats for core_date scalar.

The actual format used for userdate() is:
get_string('strftime' . strtolower($arg['format']), 'langconfig')

enumValues.name: TIMESTAMP

enumValues.name: ISO8601
enumValues.description: ISO-8601 time string in current user timezone, null if no date. Example output: 2022-09-01T12:06:53+1200

enumValues.name: DAYDATETIME
enumValues.description: Datetime string in the format: Thursday, 1 September 2022, 12:05 PM

enumValues.name: TIME
enumValues.description: Time string in the format: 12:08 PM

enumValues.name: TIMESHORT
enumValues.description: Time string in the format: 12:08

enumValues.name: DATE
enumValues.description: Date string in the format: 1 September 2022

enumValues.name: DATESHORT
enumValues.description: Date string in the format: 1 September

enumValues.name: DATELONG
enumValues.description: Date string in the format: 1/09/2022

enumValues.name: DATETIME
enumValues.description: Datetime string in the format: 1 September 2022, 12:12 PM

enumValues.name: DATETIMESHORT
enumValues.description: Datetime string in the format: 1/09/22, 12:12

enumValues.name: DATETIMELONG
enumValues.description: Datetime string in the format: 1/09/2022, 12:10

enumValues.name: DATETIMESECONDS
enumValues.description: Datetime string in the format: 1 Sep 2022 at 12:12:07

types.name: core_date
types.description:
Represents standard unix timestamps stored in database.

For input, use either an integer timestamp, numeric string or an ISO-8601 string.

Output can usually be selected via format argument. See core_date_format
enum for the list of supported formats.

types.description: User list sort order.

types.name: core_users_result
types.description: User list query result.

types.name: core_user_users_query
types.description:
Input type used when querying for a list of users. Specifies pagination and sorting information that can impact the
structure of the results.

inputFields.name: pagination
inputFields.description: Pagination information such as which page to return and the number of results requested.

inputFields.name: sort
inputFields.description:
The sort order of the query.
Allowed entity fields for the sort column are 'id', 'firstname', 'lastname', 'username' and 'timemodified'.

types.name: core_pagination_input
types.description:
Contains pagination information needed to load the next page of a query.
Note this input type supports both cursor-based and offset-based (page-based) pagination. The method to use will depend on
the implementation by the query.

inputFields.name: cursor
inputFields.description:
Next cursor. Opaque string obtained from the next_cursor property of core_pageable_result. Used by the query to
identify which records to return.

inputFields.name: limit
inputFields.description: Number of items to return.

inputFields.name: page
inputFields.description: Page number (only used by offset-based cursors).

types.name: core_sort_input
types.description: Input type for specifying sorting of arbitrary data.

inputFields.name: column
inputFields.description:
String containing either a single field or a comma-separated list of fields to be sorted by.
Allowed fields are defined in the specific data provider and should be documented in the query,
but typically column options will align with existing type field names.

inputFields.name: direction
inputFields.description: The sort direction of the column or columns.

types.name: core_sort_direction_enum
types.description: Options available when specifying the direction of a sort.

enumValues.name: ASC
enumValues.description: Sort column in ascending order. This refers to 0, 1, 2, 3 for numbers and A, B, C, D for strings.

enumValues.name: DESC
enumValues.description: Sort column in descending order. This refers to 3, 2, 1, 0 for numbers and D, C, B, A for strings.

types.name: core_user_users_result
types.description: Result returned from the core_user_users query. Contains a page of results along with pagination information.

fields.name: items
fields.description: Array of one page of users returned by the query.

fields.name: total
fields.description: Total number of users from this query (across all pages).

fields.name: next_cursor
fields.description: Cursor to request the next set of results for this query.

fields.name: is_complete
fields.description: Whether the user has currently completed the course

fields.name: is_enrolled
fields.description: Whether the user is currently enrolled in the course

fields.name: guest_access
fields.description: Whether the course allows guest access

fields.name: can_enrol
fields.description: Whether the course has self-enrolment options for the user

fields.name: can_view
fields.description: Whether the user has capabilities to access the course regardless of enrolment

fields.name: enrolment_options
fields.description: information on any enabled guest or selfenrolment instances

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the active course enrolment instance

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of enrolment, i.e. guest, self

fields.name: role_name
fields.description: The name of the role that the enrolment would assign

fields.name: custom_name
fields.description: The name of the enrolment type

fields.name: sort_order
fields.description: The sort order of the enrolment type

fields.name: password_required
fields.description: Whether the enrolment requires a password or not

types.name: mod_perform_activity_type
types.description: Represents a specific activity type (system wide category of performance activity)

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Raw name field for this type. In future when we have system types this will be
a key used to locate the type's language string.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: Human readable display name for the type to be used to describe it to end users.

types.name: mod_perform_track
types.description:
A specific track

Tracks are containers within activities that store assignment groups and scheduling information.
Currently activities always have exactly 1 track but in future we may support multiple tracks within the same activity.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Optional track description. Not currently used in interface.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the track, e.g. ACTIVE, PAUSED

fields.name: schedule_is_open
fields.description: True if the schedule is open ended (start date only), false for limited scheduling (start and end date)

fields.name: schedule_is_fixed
fields.description:
True if schedule is using fixed dates (admin specifies an actual date), false
for relative scheduling (dates calculated relative to events)

fields.name: schedule_fixed_from
fields.description: Start of scheduling period for fixed dates

fields.name: schedule_fixed_to
fields.description: End of scheduling period for limited scheduling with fixed dates

fields.name: schedule_dynamic_from
fields.description: Offset from trigger for start of scheduling period with relative dates

fields.name: schedule_dynamic_to
fields.description: Offset from trigger for end of scheduling period for limited scheduling with relative dates

fields.name: schedule_dynamic_source
fields.description: Source of trigger for relative scheduling

fields.name: schedule_use_anniversary
fields.description:
If true, if user's calculated start date is in the past on assignment, use the
next anniversary of the reference date instead of the actual reference date

fields.name: due_date_is_enabled
fields.description: True if due date options should be enabled for this track

fields.name: due_date_is_fixed
fields.description: True if scheduling is using fixed dates

fields.name: due_date_fixed
fields.description: Value for fixed due date

fields.name: due_date_offset
fields.description: Offset from trigger (currently only option is 'time since creation of instance') for relative due date

fields.name: repeating_is_enabled
fields.description: True if repeating should be enabled for this track

fields.name: repeating_trigger_interval
fields.description: Trigger for repeat instance creation

fields.name: repeating_trigger_type
fields.description: Trigger for repeat instance creation

fields.name: repeating_type
fields.description:
Trigger for repeat instance creation
@deprecated since Totara 16 - use repeating_trigger_type/repeating_trigger_interval combination instead.
This value will be UNSET if mapping back from the CLOSURE or COMPLETION_CLOSURE values in
mod_perform_track_repeating_trigger_type_enums

Note: cannot use @deprecated + reason tag after this field because the Behat tests fail!

fields.name: repeating_offset
fields.description: Offset from trigger for repeat instance creation

fields.name: repeating_is_limited
fields.description:
If true number of repeating instances that will be created will be limited to
a specific number. Otherwise no limit is used

fields.name: repeating_limit
fields.description: Number of subject instances that will be created for this user assignment, if repeating_is_limited is enabled

fields.name: assignments
fields.description: List of assignments attached to this track

fields.name: can_assign_positions
fields.description: Whether viewing user has permission to assign positions

fields.name: can_assign_organisations
fields.description: Whether viewing user has permission to assign organisations

types.name: mod_perform_track_subject_instance_generation_enums
types.description: A list of possible job behaviours for subject instance generation which a track can be set to

enumValues.name: ONE_PER_SUBJECT
enumValues.description:
When selected one subject instance will be created for each matching user.
The subject instance will refer to the user as a whole rather than any particular job.

enumValues.name: ONE_PER_JOB
enumValues.description:
When selected one subject instance will be created for each job assignment of each matching user.
The subject instance will refer to the specific job assignment as being the topic of the activity.

types.name: mod_perform_dynamic_date_offset
types.description: An object defining the information required to determine a real offset from a specific event trigger.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number indicating how far from the trigger event the calculated date will be

fields.name: unit
fields.description: Unit of time used to convert the count into an actual period of time in seconds

fields.name: direction
fields.description: Direction to apply the count/unit time period to calculate a date relative to a trigger event

types.name: mod_perform_track_dynamic_unit_enums
types.description: A list of possible units which can be used for relative dynamic date schedules

types.name: mod_perform_track_dynamic_direction_enums
types.description: A list of possible directions which can be used for relative dynamic date schedules

types.name: mod_perform_dynamic_date_source
types.description:
Represents a pointer to a specific dynamic date source, where a date source is comprised of a dynamic
date resolver class and a option key.

fields.name: resolver_class_name
fields.description: Fully qualified class name of the date resolver for this source

fields.name: option_key
fields.description: Option key passed to the resolver to calculate the relevant result

fields.name: display_name
fields.description:
Display name of the option itself, used in cases when the resolver or option_key become unavailable and we still
want to display a selected but deleted option.

fields.name: is_available
fields.description: True when this source is currently available in code

fields.name: custom_setting_component
fields.description:
Optional Vue component path to be added into the relative scheduling settings
Used to allow the source to collect additional data from the user (such as
selecting a specific activity to schedule relative to).

fields.name: custom_data
fields.description: Custom data passed to the source to assist with resolving the date

fields.name: resolver_base
fields.description: Return what the resolver is based on (user, job, etc)

types.name: mod_perform_track_repeating_trigger_interval_enums
types.description: Interval type before repeating trigger fires

enumValues.name: MINIMUM_TIME_SINCE_CREATION
enumValues.description: Future subject instance created after a minimum interval has passed since the creation of the previous instance

enumValues.name: TIME_SINCE
enumValues.description: Future subject instance created at an interval relative to the setting of a value in the previous instance

types.name: mod_perform_track_repeating_trigger_type_enums
types.description: A list of possible repeating triggers which can be used for repeating schedules

enumValues.name: CREATION
enumValues.description: Future instance triggered after the creation of a previous instance

enumValues.name: COMPLETION
enumValues.description: Future subject instance created at a time relative to the completion of a previous instance

enumValues.name: CLOSURE
enumValues.description: Future subject instance created at a time relative to the closure of a previous instance

enumValues.name: COMPLETION_CLOSURE
enumValues.description: Future subject instance created at a time relative to the completion OR closure of a previous instance

types.name: mod_perform_track_repeating_type_enums
types.description:
A list of possible repeating types which can be used for repeating schedules
Deprecated since Totara 16; replaced by repeating_trigger_interval_enums/track_repeating_trigger_type_enums
combination

enumValues.name: AFTER_CREATION
enumValues.description: Creation of future instances will occur some time after the creation of the previous instance

enumValues.name: AFTER_CREATION_WHEN_COMPLETE
enumValues.description: Creation of future instances will occur some time after the creation of the previous instance but only once it is complete

enumValues.name: AFTER_COMPLETION
enumValues.description: Creation of future instances will occur some time relative to the completion of the previous instance

enumValues.name: UNSET
enumValues.description:
Temporary option; returned when mapping back from the CLOSURE or COMPLETION_CLOSURE values
in mod_perform_track_repeating_trigger_type_enums

types.name: ID
types.description:
The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to
refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON
response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer
(such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

enumValues.description: State to use for a notification to provide information, rather than the result of an action.

enumValues.description: State to use for a notification when there was an issue that you want to warn about, but that is not an error.

enumValues.description: State to use for a notification about an error, when something has failed in some way.

The course_id is mandatory, and the current user must be able to access the course

fields.name: core_file_unused_draft_item_id
fields.description:
A mutation to fetch the unused draft item id.
This is mutation because, if it is a query, apollo-client will try to squeeze
the multiple requests into one - as they are identical to each other.
Hence, mutation will be better because it will assure that each of query within multiple
instnaces to be executed.

Note that: `fetchPolicy: 'no-cache'` does not help at all.

types.name: core_user_create_user_input
types.description: Input provided when creating a user.

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description:
Username for the user. This field is used in combination with the password for logging in with some authentication types.
Username must be unique on the site.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: Email address of the user. Must be unique unless 'allowaccountssameemail' setting is enabled (not recommended).

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description:
Initial password for user. This will only be used with certain auth methods such as 'manual'.
This field is required unless you set generate_password to true.

inputFields.name: firstname
inputFields.description: First name of the user.

inputFields.name: lastname
inputFields.description: Last name of the user.

inputFields.name: idnumber
inputFields.description: The id number of the user.

inputFields.name: firstnamephonetic
inputFields.description: Optional phonetic spelling of the user's first name.

inputFields.name: lastnamephonetic
inputFields.description: Optional phonetic spelling of the user's last name.

inputFields.name: middlename
inputFields.description: Middle name of the user.

inputFields.name: alternatename
inputFields.description: Alternate name of the user.

inputFields.name: city
inputFields.description: City where the user is located. If not provided the system will use the admin setting 'defaultcity' if set.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Rich-text description field for the user's profile.

inputFields.name: descriptionformat
inputFields.description: Format of the description field for the user's profile. See core_format for options.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: URL for the user's profile.

inputFields.name: skype
inputFields.description: Skype username for the user's profile.

inputFields.name: institution
inputFields.description:
Institution (organisation) the user belongs to, for the user's profile. This
is not connected to job assignment organisation.

inputFields.name: department
inputFields.description: Department the user belongs to.

inputFields.name: phone1
inputFields.description: Primary phone number of the user.

inputFields.name: phone2
inputFields.description: Secondary phone number of the user.

inputFields.name: address
inputFields.description: The user's address.

inputFields.name: country
inputFields.description:
ISO-3166 two-letter country code of the user, e.g. 'NZ'. Country code list:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2.

inputFields.name: timezone
inputFields.description:
Timezone of the user, as a string, for example 'Pacific/Auckland'. If not
provided the value from the admin setting 'timezone'
will be used instead. We recommend using location-based timezones rather than UTC+1 etc. A list of available timezones can
be found at https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.php.

Note that if the admin setting 'forcetimezone' is configured, any value provided
here will be stored but not displayed/used - the forcetimezone value will be used instead.

inputFields.name: lang
inputFields.description: Language of the user, for example 'en_us'. Valid options depend on the site's installed language packs.

inputFields.name: theme
inputFields.description:
Theme setting for the user. If the Totara system setting for 'allow user themes' is enabled, then a valid theme name
will be accepted from this request, e.g. 'ventura'. If the system setting is
disabled, then the theme value will be ignored.

inputFields.name: auth
inputFields.description:
Authentication plugin for this user, for example 'manual'. The available options will depend on which authentication
plugins are installed and enabled on the site.

inputFields.name: calendartype
inputFields.description:
Calendar type for this user, for example 'gregorian'. The available options will depend on which calendar plugins are
installed and enabled on the site.

inputFields.name: emailstop
inputFields.description: Whether this user should be completely prevented from receiving any email notifications. Default is false.

inputFields.name: suspended
inputFields.description: Whether this user should be marked as suspended. Suspended users are unable to log in. Default is false.

inputFields.name: tenant
inputFields.description:
A reference to a tenant that the user should be assigned to. The API client must be permitted to assign the specified
tenant. If not given the user will be automatically assigned based on the API client's tenant, or to the System.

Ignored if multitenancy is disabled.

inputFields.name: custom_fields
inputFields.description:
Optional array of custom profile field data (each array element describes a single custom field value for this user).
Hidden and restricted custom fields require 'moodle/user:viewalldetails' capability.

inputFields.name: force_password_change
inputFields.description: Prompt the user to change their password on their next login.

inputFields.name: generate_password
inputFields.description: Generate a random password for the user and send it to them via email.

types.name: param_email
types.description: Input parameter equivalent to PARAM_EMAIL, '' is converted to NULL.

types.name: totara_tenant_tenant_reference
types.description:
Input for identifying a tenant.

The tenant must be specified by providing one of the following:

* The tenant's internal database id
* The tenant's idnumber

A tenant reference must uniquely identify a single tenant to be valid.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Identify a tenant by the internal database id of the tenant.

inputFields.name: idnumber
inputFields.description:
Identify a tenant by the idnumber of the tenant. This is a unique reference
used to represent the tenant across multiple systems.

types.name: core_user_custom_field_input
types.description: Input type representing a single custom field for a particular user.

inputFields.name: shortname
inputFields.description:
Shortname is used to uniquely identify the custom field the data is for. It must exactly match the shortname
of a custom field that exists on the site or an error will be thrown. Note if the same shortname is provided
multiple times in a request (not recommended) they will be applied in order so the last one will be used.

inputFields.name: data
inputFields.description:
Represents the value for the custom field for this user. This field is required unless the delete flag is set.
The format of this data will depend on the field type of the field specified by shortname:

* checkbox: string of 0 (unchecked) or 1 (checked).
* menu: A string exactly matching one of the menu options (case sensitive).
* text: A string of plain-text.
* textarea: A string of formatted text, in the format specified via the data_format field (see below).
* datetime: A string in the format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD-HH-MM-SS
(depending on if the field uses the 'Include time?' option).
If the field defines a year range, the input will be validated to ensure it
falls within that range. If only YYYY-MM-DD is provided for
a field where 'Include time?' is enabled, midnight will be used for the time.
Stored as a unix timestamp using the timezone of the client's service account.
* date: A string in the format YYYY-MM-DD. Stored as a timestamp so uses noon UTC for time to ensure
  date displayed is consistent across most timezones.

inputFields.name: data_format
inputFields.description:
Optional property, which must be provided textarea field types but should not
be passed for other types. Used to record the format of the 'data' field so it
can be correctly rendered.
Options are:
* 1: HTML
* 2: Plain-text
* 4: Markdown
* 5: JSON

inputFields.name: delete
inputFields.description:
Flag indicating that the data for this custom field should be deleted. This
flag should only be set if not passing new or updated data for the field.

types.name: core_user_user_result
types.description:
Mutation result type returned after creation of a new user or updates to an existing user.
Returns the user that was created or updated.

fields.name: user
fields.description: User object for the user that was created or updated as part of the operation.

types.name: core_user_user_reference
types.description:
Input for identifying a user.

The user must be specified by providing one of the following:

* The user's internal database id
* The user's idnumber
* The user's username
* The user's email address

A user reference must uniquely identify a single user to be valid. Deleted users are excluded, as are users not
accessible due to multitenancy restrictions.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Internal database id of the user.

inputFields.name: username

types.name: core_user_update_user_input
types.description: Input provided when updating a user.

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description:
Username for the user. This field is used in combination with the password for logging in with some authentication types.
Username must be unique on the site.

inputFields.name: firstname
inputFields.description: First name of the user.

inputFields.name: lastname
inputFields.description: Last name of the user.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: Email address of the user. Must be unique unless 'allowaccountssameemail' admin setting is enabled.

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description: New password for the user. This will only be used with certain auth methods such as 'manual'.

inputFields.name: idnumber
inputFields.description: The id number of the user.

inputFields.name: firstnamephonetic
inputFields.description: Optional phonetic spelling of the user's first name.

inputFields.name: lastnamephonetic
inputFields.description: Optional phonetic spelling of the user's last name.

inputFields.name: middlename
inputFields.description: Middle name of the user.

inputFields.name: alternatename
inputFields.description: Alternate name of the user.

inputFields.name: city
inputFields.description: City where the user is located. If not provided the system will use the admin setting 'defaultcity' if set.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Rich-text description field for the user's profile.

inputFields.name: descriptionformat
inputFields.description: Rich-text format of the description field.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: URL for the user's profile.

inputFields.name: skype
inputFields.description: Skype username for the user's profile.

inputFields.name: institution
inputFields.description:
Institution (organisation) the user belongs to, for the user's profile. This
is not connected to job assignment organisation.

inputFields.name: department
inputFields.description: Department the user belongs to.

inputFields.name: phone1
inputFields.description: Primary phone number of the user.

inputFields.name: phone2
inputFields.description: Secondary phone number of the user.

inputFields.name: address
inputFields.description: The user's address.

inputFields.name: country
inputFields.description:
ISO-3166 two-letter country code of the user, e.g. 'NZ'. Country code list:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2.

inputFields.name: timezone
inputFields.description:
Timezone of the user, as a string, for example 'Pacific/Auckland'. We recommend using location-based timezones rather
than UTC+1 etc. A list of available timezones can be found at https://www.php.net/manual/en/timezones.php.

Note that if the admin setting 'forcetimezone' is configured, any value provided
here will be stored but not displayed/used - the forcetimezone value will be used instead.

inputFields.name: lang
inputFields.description: Language of the user, for example 'en_us'. Valid options depend on the site's installed language packs.

inputFields.name: theme
inputFields.description:
Theme setting for the user. If the admin setting 'allowuserthemes' is enabled, then a valid theme name
will be accepted from this request, e.g. 'ventura'. If that admin setting is
disabled, then the theme value will be ignored.

inputFields.name: auth
inputFields.description:
Authentication plugin for this user, for example 'manual'. The available options will depend on which authentication
plugins are installed and enabled on the site.

inputFields.name: calendartype
inputFields.description:
Calendar type for this user, for example 'gregorian'. The available options will depend on which calendar plugins are
installed and enabled on the site.

inputFields.name: emailstop
inputFields.description: Whether this user should be completely prevented from receiving any email notifications. Default is false.

inputFields.name: suspended
inputFields.description: Whether this user should be marked as suspended. Suspended users are unable to log in. Default is false.

inputFields.name: tenant
inputFields.description:
A reference to a tenant that the user should be assigned to. The API client
must be permitted to assign the specified tenant.
To change tenant the API client must have 'totara/tenant:manageparticipants' capability in system context.

inputFields.name: custom_fields
inputFields.description:
Optional array of custom profile field data (each array element describes a single custom field value for this user).
Hidden and restricted custom fields require 'moodle/user:viewalldetails' capability.

inputFields.name: force_password_change
inputFields.description: Prompt the user to change their password on their next login.

inputFields.name: generate_password
inputFields.description: Generate a random password for the user and send it to them via email.

types.name: param_username
types.description: Input parameter equivalent to PARAM_USERNAME, '' is converted to NULL.

* The position's idnumber

A position reference must uniquely identify a single position to be valid.

inputFields.description:
Identify a position by its idnumber. idnumber is a unique reference used to
represent the position across multiple systems.

types.description: A type to hold the result of data validation.

inputFields.name: resolver_class_name
inputFields.description:
The event resolver's name that this notification preference is
set for MUST be provided.

inputFields.name: extended_context
inputFields.description:
Extended context MUST be provided, in order to create the notification preference
within that context. Note that the context's id for this extended_context can be fallback
to the context system if none is provided.

inputFields.name: ancestor_id
inputFields.description:
If ancestor_id is provided, then we would know that this notification preference
is overriding one of the notification preference at under context.

inputFields.name: recipients
inputFields.description:
The class_names of recipients for the custom notification. Able to be set to
null, ONLY if this very notification preference can fallback to the parent, or
the system built in notification that has a default value.

inputFields.name: forced_delivery_channels
inputFields.description: An array of delivery channel's identifier names. It is optional to be provided.

inputFields.name: body
inputFields.description:
Note that these fields bellow are able to set to null.
Only if this very notification preference can fallback to the parent, or
the system built in notification that has default values.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
